Schedulers#

class bert_squeeze.utils.schedulers.theseus_schedulers.ConstantReplacementScheduler(bert_encoder: TheseusBertEncoder, replacing_rate: float, replacing_steps: int | None = None)[source]#

Scheduler implementing layer replacement for Theseus Bert.

It replaces the original layers with the compressed ones using the replacement rate p defined as follows:

p = r if t < replacing_steps else 1

where r is the replacing rate and t is the current optimization step.

Parameters:

  • bert_encoder (TheseusBertEncoder) – Encoder of Theseus Bert

  • replacing_rate (float) – Probability to use within the Bernoulli distribution for layer replacement.

  • replacing_steps (int) – Number of steps after which the replacing_rate is set to 1. This means that the model will only use the compressed layers.

step() → float[source]#

Increments the scheduler and will set the replacing_rate to 1.0 when t >= replacing_steps otherwise self.replacing_rate.

Returns:

Replacing rate

Return type:

float

class bert_squeeze.utils.schedulers.theseus_schedulers.LinearReplacementScheduler(bert_encoder: TheseusBertEncoder, base_replacing_rate: float, coefficient: int)[source]#

Scheduler implementing layer replacement for Theseus Bert

It replaces the original layers with the compressed ones using the replacement rate p defined as follow:

p = min(1, kt + b)

where k > 0 is the coefficient, b is the basic replacement rate and t the current optimization step.

Parameters:

  • bert_encoder (TheseusBertEncoder) – Encoder of Theseus Bert

  • base_replacing_rate (float) – Probability to use within the Bernoulli distribution for layer replacement.

  • coefficient (int) – Coefficient of the linear scheduler (slope in kt+b).

step() → float[source]#

Increments the scheduler and will set the replacing_rate to 1.0 when t >= replacing_steps otherwise to kt + b.

Returns:

replacing rate

Return type:

float
